marketNews.title: UNVR FY24: Net Income -30% YoY, Below Expectations
marketNews.content: Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) only recorded net income of 359 billion Rupiah in 4Q24 (-41% YoY, -34% QoQ), lower compared to the net income in 4Q23 when the boycott sentiment was at its peak. This result caused the net income for 2024 to reach only 3.4 trillion Rupiah (-30% YoY), below expectations because it only met 90% of the consensus estimate. The restructuring program currently being carried out by the company remains the main factor significantly suppressing short-term performance. Sales were impacted by the decision to reduce inventory at the distributor level, while profitability/margins plummeted due to transformation costs. Gross profit margin has been hovering at a low level of ~45% in the last 2 quarters (vs. previous normal: 49-50%) due to declining sales and transformation costs. Specifically in 4Q24, UNVR also booked one-off costs related to employee reductions, causing operating expenses for 'Salary' to surge, both in the 'Selling & Marketing' category (+110% YoY, +67% QoQ) and the 'General & Administrative' category (+55% YoY, +170% QoQ). UNVR management expects the restructuring program to continue in 1H25, so the company's performance will still be burdened, although with a smaller impact than what was felt in 4Q24. Positive results from this restructuring are expected to start showing in 2H25. Key Takeaway: With the strengthening of UNVR's stock price by +2.91% on Thursday (13/2) and +3.53% on Friday (14/2), we see the market responding positively to management's expectation that the company's worst performance has been passed in 4Q24 and will improve going forward. Progress from this restructuring program is something investors need to observe and monitor, as it will be the key factor determining the recovery of UNVR's stock price, in our view. *This article was previously released in Stockbit Commentary on Friday (14/2) morning.

marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump Orders Cabinet to Consider Reciprocal Tariffs on Trade Partners
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, on Thursday (13/2) ordered his cabinet to consider the implementation of reciprocal tariffs on a number of trade partners. US Secretary of Commerce, Howard Lutnick, stated that all studies related to reciprocal tariffs will be completed by April 1, 2025, allowing Trump to act immediately afterward. Bloomberg reported that these reciprocal tariffs will be adjusted for each country to offset the tariffs imposed by trading partners on the US. Furthermore, the consideration for imposing reciprocal tariffs includes not only the tariffs imposed by partner countries on US exports but also non-tariff barriers implemented by those countries such as unfair subsidies, regulations, value-added tax, exchange rates, lax intellectual property protection, and other factors deemed capable of restricting US trade. Trump also stated that he will impose import levies on cars, semiconductors, and pharmaceuticals at higher rates than the reciprocal tariffs.

marketNews.title: Residential Property Price Growth Slows in 4Q24, Sales Contracted
marketNews.content: The residential property price survey from Bank Indonesia showed that residential property price growth slowed to +1.39% YoY in 4Q24 (3Q24: +1.46% YoY), marking the weakest increase since 4Q21. Meanwhile, residential property sales experienced a contraction of -15.09% YoY (vs. 3Q24: -7.14% YoY), pressured by the contraction of small-type houses (-16.61% YoY vs. 3Q24: -10.05% YoY) and medium-type houses (-23.7% YoY vs. 3Q24: -8.8% YoY), amidst an increase in large-type house sales (+20.44% YoY vs. 3Q24: +6.83% YoY).

marketNews.title: Minister of SOEs opens option to merge Construction SOEs into one entity
marketNews.content: Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, said on Thursday (13/2) that he is opening the option to redesign the merger of Construction SOEs from 7 companies down to just 1 entity remaining, fewer than the previous plan of 3 entities. Erick mentioned that the merger plan for Construction SOEs has the potential to be readjusted along with state expenditure efficiency. Although the plan to consolidate the number of Construction SOEs from 7 entities to 3 entities is ongoing, Erick does not rule out the possibility that the number of surviving entities post-consolidation will decrease.

marketNews.title: ESDM Director General expects B40 biodiesel program to be fully implemented by March 2025
marketNews.content: Director General of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM), Eniya Listiani Dewi, stated on Friday (14/2) that the government targets the B40 biodiesel program to be fully implemented by March 2025, after a transition period was granted due to the delay in releasing technical regulations at the beginning of the year. Eniya also mentioned that CPO-based biodiesel distribution since the beginning of 2025 has reached approximately 1.2 million kiloliters as of Friday (14/2), equivalent to 7.7% of the 2025 allocation of 15.6 million kiloliters. The 2025 biodiesel allocation volume is higher than the 2024 allocation of 13 million kiloliters, thus requiring higher subsidies to boost production. Previously, the government planned to raise the export levy on crude CPO from 7.5% to 10% to finance this subsidy increase, but the official decision to implement the new levy is still in process, according to the President Director of the Palm Oil Plantation Fund Management Agency, Eddy Abdurrachman.

marketNews.title: Japan's Inpex Targets FID for Indonesia's Abadi LNG Project in 2027
marketNews.content: Japan's largest oil and gas exploration company, Inpex Corp. (TYO: 1605), stated on Thursday (13/2) that it will make a final investment decision (FID) on the Abadi liquefied natural gas (LNG) project in the Masela Block in 2027. Based on its business plan until 2027, Inpex plans to invest 1.8 trillion Yen in growth areas, including the Ichthys LNG project in Australia. Inpex holds a 65% stake in the Abadi LNG project, where the company plans to commence engineering design in early 2025 and could start production in the block in the early 2030s. Previously, the Abadi LNG project had experienced years of delays alongside planning changes and divestment from Shell (LON: SHEL), which sold its 35% stake to PT Pertamina and Petronas in 2023.

marketNews.title: Freeport Indonesia Set to Resume Copper Concentrate Exports This Month Pending New Permit
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that PT Freeport Indonesia will resume copper concentrate exports this month if it receives a new export permit. Reuters sources mentioned that PT Freeport Indonesia will start loading cargo destined for China on Friday (14/2), with the hope that the company will receive the export permit by the end of February 2025. Previously, the Ministry of Trade stated last week that it would support PT Freeport Indonesia to continue copper concentrate exports. Neither PT Freeport Indonesia nor the Ministry of ESDM has commented on this issue.

marketNews.title: eFishery Cuts About 90% of Jobs Amid Potential Liquidation
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that eFishery has cut more than 1,000 employees, or about 90% of its workforce, as the agritech startup, which is allegedly committing fraud, is considering the possibility of liquidation. Bloomberg sources stated that these layoffs started recently and further reductions will follow.

tickerNews.title: ISAT Denies Acquisition Rumors by WIFI; WIFI Also Denies Acquisition Plan of ISAT
tickerNews.content: $ISAT: Indosat in a clarification to the IDX denied rumors that the company would be acquired by Solusi Sinergi Digital ($WIFI). ISAT also stated that as of now the company is not discussing potential cooperation or acquisition with WIFI. Besides ISAT, WIFI also denied the rumor that the company plans to acquire ISAT. Previously, Bloomberg Technoz reported that WIFI plans to take over ISAT from Ooredoo Hutchison Asia Pte. Ltd.

tickerNews.title: BMRI Confirms Continued Support for Mineral Downstreaming Despite End of BI Liquidity Incentives
tickerNews.content: $BMRI: Bank Mandiri Corporate Secretary, M. Ashidiq Iswara, stated that the bank will continue to support the acceleration of downstreaming in Indonesia, even if Bank Indonesia does not continue liquidity incentives for banks channeling credit for mineral and coal downstreaming in 2025. Ashidiq explained that downstreaming credit provided by BMRI will focus on strategic projects with significant economic impact, where debtors must have sufficient raw material supply and the availability of offtakers to mitigate the bank's risks. Previously, Minister of ESDM, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated that downstreaming projects would be financed by the Danantara Investment Management Agency through BMRI. Besides BMRI, the President Director of Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI), Royke Tumilaar, also mentioned that his party is ready to channel credit for downstreaming if the project is promising, even without liquidity incentives.

tickerNews.title: DEWA to Reduce Subcontracting After Intensifying New Heavy Equipment Purchases Following Debt Conversion Approval
tickerNews.content: $DEWA: Darma Henwa Director, Sorimuda Pulungan, stated that the company is intensively purchasing new heavy equipment to improve revenue performance. With the purchase of new equipment, projects owned by DEWA that have so far been handed over to other mining contractor companies can be reduced. This decision was taken by the company after receiving approval to conduct a private placement to convert debt of approximately 1.4 trillion Rupiah, based on the EGM on Thursday (13/2). Bisnis reported that DEWA currently has 4 operational projects, consisting of the Bengalon project owned by PT Kaltim Prima Coal, the Asam Asam and Kintap projects owned by PT Arutmin Indonesia, and the Lubuk Tutung port service.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Controller and President Director Bought ~1.3 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $HEAL: The controller and President Director of Medikaloka Hermina, Hasmoro, purchased approximately 1.3 million HEAL shares at an average price of 1,304 Rupiah per share on February 11-12, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.7 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, Hasmoro's ownership in HEAL increased from 4.725% to ~4.734%.

tickerNews.title: MIKA Controller Bought 952,200 Shares
tickerNews.content: $MIKA: The controller of Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat, PT Griyainsani Cakrasadaya, purchased 952,200 MIKA shares at an average price of 2,366 Rupiah per share on January 24, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.3 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Griyainsani Cakrasadaya in MIKA increased from 63.99% to 64%.

tickerNews.title: BRIS Obtains OJK Approval to Operate as Bullion Bank; Previously Partnered with HRTA for Gold Product
tickerNews.content: $BRIS: The President Director of Bank Syariah Indonesia, Hery Gunardi, stated that his party has obtained permission from OJK to conduct bullion bank or gold bank business activities. With this, BRIS becomes the second financial service company to obtain a gold bank business license after Bank Rakyat Indonesia's ($BBRI) subsidiary, PT Pegadaian. Gold bank services cover the purchase, sale, storage, and financing of gold. In November 2024, BRIS also collaborated with Hartadinata Abadi ($HRTA) to launch the BSI Gold product.

tickerNews.title: BUVA Plans Rights Issue up to 3.6 Billion New Shares, Meeting Set for March 24, 2025
tickerNews.content: $BUVA: Bukit Uluwatu Villa plans to hold a rights issue of up to 3.6 billion new shares, with a maximum dilution effect of 17.48%. The exercise price and ratio have not yet been announced, while the proceeds are intended for financing upcoming projects, inorganic growth, and/or the settlement of the company's obligations. This plan will be discussed in the EGM on March 24, 2025.

tickerNews.title: MARK Director Bought 870,000 Shares
tickerNews.content: $MARK: Mark Dynamics Indonesia Director, Chow Kun Jian, purchased 870,000 MARK shares at an average price of 950 Rupiah per share on February 14, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 826 million Rupiah. After this transaction, Chow Kun Jian's ownership in MARK increased from none to 0.02%.

tickerNews.title: MPMX Directors Purchased Shares as Part of Long-Term Incentive Program
tickerNews.content: $MPMX: Members of the Board of Directors of Mitra Pinasthika Mustika - consisting of Suwito Mawarwati, Beatrice Kartika, and Kemal Mawira - each purchased 2.2 million, 1.3 million, and 144,800 MPMX shares at an average price of 970 Rupiah per share on February 7, 2025. The total value of these three transactions reached approximately 3.6 billion Rupiah. After these transactions, Suwito Mawarwati's ownership in MPMX increased from 0.37% to 0.42%, while Beatrice Kartika's ownership increased from 0.136% to 0.166%, and Kemal Mawira's ownership increased from 0.005% to 0.008%. These transactions are part of the company's long-term incentive program execution.

tickerNews.title: Danantara Investment Management Agency to Launch on February 24, 2025, with Rp14,000 Trillion in Assets Under Management, Will Take Over SOE Stakes including BMRI, BBRI, BBNI
tickerNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto stated on Thursday (13/2) that the Danantara Investment Management Agency will be released on February 24, 2025, with managed assets reaching 14,715 trillion Rupiah. Prabowo stated that the initial funding for Danantara is projected to reach 20 billion US Dollars. Danantara itself will invest in high-impact sustainable projects across all sectors - such as new and renewable energy, advanced manufacturing, downstream industries, and food production - to drive Indonesia's economic growth to reach a target of +8%. Danantara will also take over all government ownership stakes in State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN), including Bank Mandiri ($BMRI), Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI), and Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI).

tickerNews.title: SQMI Controller Sold 750 Million Shares for Collateral Agreement
tickerNews.content: $SQMI: The controller of Wilton Makmur Indonesia, Wilton Resources Holding Pte. Ltd., sold 750 million SQMI shares at an average price of 20 Rupiah per share on February 6, 2025. The total transaction value reached 15 billion Rupiah and was intended for a collateral agreement. After this transaction, the ownership of Wilton Resources Holding Pte.
